metadata.title: V-36029: The MDM server must be capable of scanning the hardware version of managed mobile devices and alert if unsupported versions are found.
metadata.description: Approved versions of devices have gone though all required phases of testing, approval, etc., and are able to support required security features. Using non-approved versions of mobile device hardware could compromise the security baseline of the mobile system, since some required security features may not be supported.

metadata.title: V-36085: The MDM server must prevent the installation of applications that are not digitally signed with an organizationally accepted private key.
metadata.description: Any additions of applications can potentially have significant effects on the overall security of the system. Digital signatures on code provide assurance that the code comes from a known source and has not been modified. This feature is a key malware control on mobile devices.

criterion.comment: All apps must be signed by authorized key

metadata.title: V-36086: The MDM server must be configured to provide the administrative functionality to transmit a remote Data Wipe command, including removable media cards, to a managed mobile device.
metadata.description: Without a Data Wipe capability, the data on the mobile device can be compromised in the event of a lost or stolen device.

metadata.title: V-36088, V-36132: The MDM server must have the administrative functionality to centrally manage the following security policy rule on managed mobile devices: Perform a Data Wipe function whereby all data stored in user addressable memory on the mobile device and the removable memory card is erased when the maximum number of incorrect passwords for device unlock has been reached. The MDM server must have the administrative functionality to centrally manage the following security policy rule on managed mobile devices: Set the number of incorrect password attempts before a data wipe procedure is initiated (minimum requirement is 3-10).
metadata.description: Security-related parameters are those parameters impacting the security state of the system and include parameters related to the implementation of other IA controls. If these controls are not implemented, the system may be vulnerable to a variety of attacks. The use of an MDM server allows an organization to assign values to Security-related parameters across all the devices it manages. This provides assurance that the required mobile OS security controls are being enforced, and that the device user or an adversary has not modified or disabled the controls. It also greatly increases efficiency and manageability of devices in a large scale environment relative to an environment in which each device must be configured separately. Data wipe could be accomplished by deleting the data-at-rest encryption key (data obfuscation). Security-related parameters are those parameters impacting the security state of the system and include parameters related to the implementation of other IA controls. If these controls are not implemented, the system may be vulnerable to a variety of attacks. The use of an MDM server allows an organization to assign values to Security-related parameters across all the devices it manages. This provides assurance that the required mobile OS security controls are being enforced, and that the device user or an adversary has not modified or disabled the controls. It also greatly increases efficiency and manageability of devices in a large scale environment relative to an environment in which each device must be configured separately.

criterion.comment: Must perform data wipe after certain # of incorrect password tries

metadata.title: V-36090: The MDM server must have the administrative functionality to centrally manage the following security policy rule on managed mobile devices: Enable or disable data-at-rest encryption on the mobile device.
metadata.description: Security-related parameters are those parameters impacting the security state of the system and include parameters related to the implementation of other IA controls. If these controls are not implemented, the system may be vulnerable to a variety of attacks. The use of an MDM server allows an organization to assign values to Security-related parameters across all the devices it manages. It also greatly increases efficiency and manageability of devices in a large scale environment relative to an environment in which each device must be configured separately.

criterion.comment: Enable/disable DAR encryption policy on device

metadata.title: V-36091: The MDM server must have the administrative functionality to centrally manage the following security policy rule on managed mobile devices: Enable or disable device unlock password.

metadata.title: V-36093: The MDM server must have the administrative functionality to centrally manage the following security policy rule on managed mobile devices: Minimum password length for the device unlock password is configured to the organizationally defined value when DoD sensitive data is being protected.

metadata.title: V-36095: The MDM server must have the administrative functionality to centrally manage the following security policy rule on managed mobile devices: Device inactivity timeout whereby the user must reenter their user password or Smart Card PIN to unlock the device.

metadata.title: V-36096: The MDM server must have the administrative functionality to centrally manage the following security policy rule on managed mobile devices: Set the device inactivity timeout (the following settings must be available, at a minimum: Disable (no timeout), 15 minutes, and 60 minutes).

criterion.comment: Enable/disable USB port mass storage mode.

metadata.title: V-36150: The MDM server must provide the administrative functionality to specify a list of approved applications that must be installed on the mobile device and cannot be removed by the user.
metadata.description: DoD can perform due diligence on sources of software to mitigate the risk that malicious software is introduced to those sources. Therefore, if software is downloaded from a DoD approved source, then it is less likely to be malicious than if it is downloaded from an unapproved source. To prevent access to unapproved sources, the operating system in most cases can be configured to disable user access to public application stores. In some cases, some applications are required for secure operation of the mobile devices controlled by the MDM server. In these cases, the ability for users to remove the application is needed as to ensure proper secure operations of the device.

criterion.comment: Confirm that required applications are installed.

app_manager_test.comment: All apps must be signed by authorized key

password_test.comment: Must perform data wipe after certain # of incorrect password tries

encryption_test.comment: Enable/disable DAR encryption policy on device

location_service_test.comment: Enable/disable location services – similar to V-36110.

device_settings_test.comment: Enable/disable USB port mass storage mode.

app_manager_test.comment: Confirm that required applications are installed.

system_details_state.comment: Match only whitelisted system_details_item entity values.

app_manager_state.comment: Match only whitelisted app_manager_item entity values.

device_settings_state.comment: Match a whitelisted device_admin MDM app value.

password_state.comment: Require a wipe policy be set.

encryption_state.comment: Require data-at-rest encryption is enabled and active

password_state.comment: Require a minimum password length of 8.
Require timeout period of more than 0 to ensure re-authentication.
Require device inactivity timeout to 60 minutes (in ms).

bluetooth_state.comment: Require Bluetooth settings to be disabled and non-discoverable.

network_state.comment: No NFC settings in current schema.

camera_state.comment: Require the camera to be disabled

device_settings_state.comment: Require policy to disallow non-Market apps to be installed.

location_service_state.comment: Require network location services to be disabled.

camera_state.comment: Require the video camera to be disabled

device_settings_state.comment: Require USB mass storage to be disabled.

Whitelist of allowed application signer values for V-36085
Whitelist of allowed MDM apps for V-36086
Minimum number of allowed incorrect password attempts before device wipe for V-36088, V-36132
